answers.text: universities in the U.S., Europe, India, China and South Africa, have received grants to develop innovative on-site and off-site waste treatment solutions

qas.question: How much were the grants for

answers.text: The grants were in the order of 400,000 USD for their first phase, followed by typically 1-3 million USD for their second phase
many of them investigated resource recovery or processing technologies for excreta or fecal sludge.

plausible_answers.text: investigated resource recovery or processing technologies for excreta or fecal sludge.

qas.question: What did the Reinvent the Toilet Challenge investigate?

plausible_answers.text: the U.S., Europe, India, China and South Africa

qas.question: What off-site treatment solutions received grants?
After receiving 1-3 million for the first phase how much were the grants for the second phase?

plausible_answers.text: more than a dozen research teams

qas.question: How many teams received grants to help universities?

plausible_answers.text: innovative on-site and off-site waste treatment solutions for the urban poor

qas.question: Since the launch of investigating resource recovery what did the grants develop?
